action.action-desc: Ms. Bonamici (for herself and Ms. Stefanik) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and the Workforce

form.official-title: To amend the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act to improve the child and adult care food program, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Early Childhood Nutrition Improvement Act.

section.header: Eligibility certification criteria for proprietary child care centers
section.text: Section 17(a)(6) of the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act (42 U.S.C. 1766(a)(6)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (E), by striking and at the end;
in subparagraph (F), by striking the period at the end and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: in the case of an institution described in paragraph (2)(B), the eligibility determination shall be in effect for 6 months after the date such institution is approved by the State under section 17(d).

section.text: Section 17(d)(5) of the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act (42 U.S.C. 1766(d)(5)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

clause.text: Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this subparagraph, the Secretary shall review and issue guidance and, as appropriate, regulations regarding the serious deficiency process for the program under this section.
In carrying out clause (i), the Secretary shall review, at a minimum, the processes for, and those involved in—

subclause.text: determining when there is a serious deficiency, including—

item.text: what measures automatically result in a finding of serious deficiency; and
how differentiation is being made between—

subitem.text: a reasonable margin of human error and systematic or intentional noncompliance; and

subclause.text: appealing and mediating a finding of serious deficiency, including—

item.text: findings related to State-specific requirements; and
processes for ensuring officials involved in appeals and mediation are fair and impartial;

subclause.text: determining the circumstances under which a corrective action plan is acceptable; and
termination and disqualification, including maintenance of the list under subparagraph (E).

After conducting the review under clause (ii), the Secretary shall make findings from the information collected and issue guidance and, as appropriate, regulations from such findings that will assist sponsoring organizations, State agencies, and the Food and Nutrition Service in ensuring a fair, uniform, and effective administration of the serious deficiency process, while retaining program integrity.
Such guidance or, as appropriate, regulations shall include—

item.text: clarity on the different measures for noncompliance;
appeals process for a finding of serious deficiency or a determination that a corrective action plan is inadequate; and
adequate timeframes under a corrective action plan for compliance that are consistent for all types of institutions, including family or group day care homes.

section.header: Authorization of reimbursements for additional meal or snack
section.text: Section 17(f)(2) of the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act (42 U.S.C. 1766(f)(2)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking (2)(A) Subject to subparagraph (B) of this paragraph and inserting the following:
by amending subparagraph (B) to read as follows:

subparagraph.text: No reimbursement may be made to any institution under this paragraph, or to family or group day care home sponsoring organizations under paragraph (3), for more than—

clause.text: 2 meals and 1 supplement or 1 meal and 2 supplements per day per child; or
3 meals and 1 supplement or 2 meals and 2 supplements per day per child, for each child that is maintained in a child care setting for more than 8 hours per day.

section.text: Section 17(f)(3)(A) of the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act (42 U.S.C. 1766(f)(3)(A)) is amended by striking Consumer Price Index for food at home each place it appears and inserting Consumer Price Index for food away from home.
Section 17 of the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act (42 U.S.C. 1766) is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this subsection, the Secretary shall establish an advisory committee (hereafter in this subsection referred to as the Advisory Committee) to carry out the duties described in paragraph (2).
The duties of the Advisory Committee shall be to—

subparagraph.text: examine the feasibility of reducing unnecessary or duplicative paperwork resulting from regulations and recordkeeping requirements, including paperwork resulting from additional State requirements, for those participating or seeking to participate in the program under this section including State agencies, family child care homes, child care centers, and sponsoring organizations; and
provide recommendations to reduce such paperwork for participants in the program under this section while ensuring that proper accountability and program integrity are maintained.

paragraph.text: The Advisory Committee shall be composed of 1 member representing each of the following entities and such other members as the Secretary determines to be appropriate:

subparagraph.text: A family or group day care home.
Sponsoring organizations for centers and family or group day care homes.

paragraph.text: In developing the recommendations described in paragraph (2), the Advisory Committee shall consider—

subparagraph.text: information, recommendations, and reports from the Paperwork Reduction Work Group established by the Food and Nutrition Service pursuant to section 119(i) of the Child Nutrition and WIC Reauthorization Act of 2004 (Public Law 108–265; 118 Stat. 755); and
the use of electronic systems and recordkeeping technologies to reduce paperwork for program participants.

paragraph.text: Not later than 2 years after the date of the enactment of this subsection, the Secretary shall issue guidance and, as appropriate, regulations based on the recommendations described in paragraph (2) for streamlined and consolidated paperwork and recordkeeping requirements for the program, including recommendations for reducing paperwork for applications and monitoring and auditing requirements.

subparagraph.text: Not later than 180 days after issuing the guidance and regulations described in paragraph (5), the Secretary shall submit a report to the Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry of the Senate and the Committee on Education and the Workforce of the House of Representatives containing the information described in subparagraph (B).
The report under subparagraph (A) shall contain the following:

clause.text: In each case in which the Secretary did not implement a recommendation of the Advisory Committee, an explanation of why such recommendation was not implemented.

Recommendations for legislative action that may further strengthen and streamline the program application and monitoring process and reduce administrative burdens on grantees, program participants, and local, State, and Federal governments.
